lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Duke.main()`. If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below:
* @param args Lunch arguments of the main method.
* @param args Lunch arguments of the main method.
* Runs command loop until the user inputs a exit command.
* Executes the command argument. If successful then saves the current task list.
* If there are unchecked exception then shows user the error message and throws an RuntimeException.
* Throwing RuntimeException is because the user would not
* be expected to handle the unchecked exception him/herself.
* @param command The command to be executed.
* @return The CommandResult of the command's execution.
* @param args The launch arguments of the main method.
* Exits the application with status code 0
* Command class representing a command to add a task.
* The task might be a todo, a deadline, or an event.
/** Command help information for adding command */
String.format("%s: add a task of a specific type to the task list.\n"
* Initializes a new AddCommand with a task.
* @param toAdd The task to be added to the list.
* Executes the adding command. Add the task into list and give feedback to user.
* @return A CommandResult Object containing feedback to user.
String message = String.format("Got it. I have added this task to your list:\n---- %s\n" +
"Now you have %d %s in total. Good luck.", toAdd.toString(), tasks.getSize(), noun);
* Parent class for all commands. This class should be abstract since
* it is meaningless to initialize instances of 'Command' only.
/** The tasks list to operate on */
/** The target index of the task list, if applicable */
* Initializes a Command Object with a target index.
* @param targetIndex The 1-based index of the task to be operated on.
* Set a task list to the command object.
* @param tasks The tasks list to operate on later.
* Executes the command. To be implemented by children classes.
* @return A CommandResult Object containing feedback to user.
* Command Result class representing the result and feedback after the command is executed.
* Initializes a CommandResult object with a feedback.
* Command class representing a command to delete a task.
/** Command help information for deleting command */
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD
+ ": Remove a specific task from the list.\n"
* Initializes a new DeleteCommand with a task index.
* @param targetIndex The 1-based index of the task to be deleted.
* Delete the task from the list and give feedback to user.
* @return A CommandResult Object containing feedback to user.
Task deleted = tasks.removeTask(targetIndex); // IndexOutOfBound Exception should be handled
String message = String.format("Got it. I have removed this task from your list:\n---- %s\n"
+ "Now you have %d %s in total. Good luck.", deleted.toString(), tasks.getSize(), noun);
* Command class representing a command to get a task done.
/** Command help information for done command */
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD
* Get the task done and give feedback to user.
* @return A CommandResult Object containing feedback to user.
Task done = tasks.getTaskDone(targetIndex); // IndexOutOfBound Exception should be handled
String message = String.format("Got it. I have mark this task as done:\n---- %s", done.toString());
* Command class representing a command to exit the application.
/** Command help information for exit command */
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD
+ ": Exit the application. Data will be auto-saved.\n"
* Exit the application and give feedback to user.
* @return A CommandResult Object containing feedback to user.
* Checks whether a command is of type ExitCommand.
* @param command The Command object to be checked.
* @return True if the Command object is of type ExitCommand, false otherwise
return command instanceof ExitCommand; // instanceof returns false if it is null
* Command class representing a command to find tasks by keyword.
/** Command help information for help command */
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD
+ ": List down all the tasks containing the key word specified.";
* Initializes a new FindCommand with a keyword.
* @param keyWord The keyword to find in tasks.
* Executes the find command. Gathers the tasks containing the keyword.
* @return A CommandResult Object containing feedback to user.
* Command class representing a command to get help.
/** Command help information for help command */
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD
* Initializes a new HelpCommand with additional boolean parameter.
* @param isAskingForHelp True if the user is really asking for help,
*                        false if the user is confused with commands
*                        and the application prompts the user to get help.
* Executes the help command. If the user is really asking for help then
* give user the help instructions. If the user is confused with commands then
* prompts the user to get help.
* @return A CommandResult Object containing feedback to user.
* Command class representing a command to list tasks.
/** Optional argument indicating the date of tasks to be listed */
/** Command help information for list command */
public static final String MESSAGE_USAGE = COMMAND_WORD
+ "List down all the tasks on a specific date, if additional date argument is given\n"

"What can I do for you today? (=V=)";
"Sorry, I do not understand your command :')\n"
+ "If you are stuck, type 'help' to get a list of operations available.";

"Sorry, the task adding failed. :( Please check your storage devices.";
"No worries! Here are the commands available:\n"

+ "please type 'list' to see available indices to delete.";

command = new ListCommand(date); // list on a specific date
